intro: Prestonia dentigera, commonly known as the toothed prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red, and they bloom in clusters. Prestonia dentigera is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
